member.name: T:Spring.Data.Support.DataRecordOrdinalCache
member.summary: Thread safe implementation of that enables fast, case insensitive, lookup for to ordinal of given field names in objects.
member.author: Kenneth Xu

member.name: T:Spring.Data.Support.IDataRecordOrdinalCache
member.summary: Defines the operation of field name to ordinal cache to improve the performance of retrieve data from by field name. Implementation must be thread safe.
member.author: Kenneth Xu

member.name: M:Spring.Data.Support.IDataRecordOrdinalCache.Init(System.Data.IDataRecord)
member.summary: Initialize the cache. Must be called at least once before any other method can be called.
member.remarks: First call will build the cache. Subsequent calls are ignored.
member.param: The object used to initialize the cache.

member.name: M:Spring.Data.Support.IDataRecordOrdinalCache.GetOrdinal(System.String)
member.summary: Get the ordinal of field with given
member.param: The name of the field.
member.returns: The cached ordinal of the field.

member.name: M:Spring.Data.Support.DataRecordOrdinalCache.Init(System.Data.IDataRecord)
member.summary: Initialize the cache. Must be called at least once before any other method can be called.
member.remarks: First call will build the cache. Subsequent calls are ignored. Please be aware that the subsequent call doesn't check against a field, so avoid calling this method for every row in an instance of .
member.param: The object used to initialize the cache.

member.name: M:Spring.Data.Support.DataRecordOrdinalCache.GetOrdinal(System.String)
member.summary: Get the ordinal of field with given

remarks.para: This implementation is case insensitive. field names with all lower case, all upper case, or exact case as returned from the method will yield fastest lookup speed. Otherwise, second attemp will be made by converting the to upper case.

member.param: The name of the field.
member.returns: The cached ordinal of the field.
member.exception: When cannot find the in cache.

member.name: T:Spring.Data.Support.DataRecordExtension
member.summary: Extension methods for .

remarks.para: This provides the convenient operations described in below sections.
SafeGetXyz methods that return default value when is encountered.
GetNullableXyz methods that return a type of the corresponding value types to handle .

Provide getter methods that indexed by field name instead of position. Those methods uses to obtain the position of field name. Due to this, those getters are generally slower then their position based couterpart, especially when the implementation of method is inefficient. for faster field name based operations.

member.author: Kenneth Xu

member.name: M:Spring.Data.Support.DataRecordExtension.GetBoolean(System.Data.IDataRecord,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of the specified field of string type.
member.param: An to get value from.
The index of the field to find.
The value of the field to be considered as true.
member.returns: true if the value of the specified field equals to the , otherwise false.

member.name: T:Spring.Data.Generic.AdoOperationsBatchExtension
member.summary: Extension Methods for .
member.author: Kenneth Xu

member.name: M:Spring.Data.Generic.AdoOperationsBatchExtension.ExecuteNonQuery``1(Spring.Data.Generic.IAdoOperations,System.Data.CommandType,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.ICollection{``0},System.Converter{``0,Spring.Data.Common.IDbParameters})
member.summary: Executes batch of non queries with common command and different parameters.
member.typeparam: The type of the data object.
member.param: An object to perform database updates.
The type of command.
The text of command.
A collection of data object to be updated in batch.
Delegate that converts data object to parameters.
member.returns: The total updated count if 0 or positive. When -1 is returned, it indicates that the update count cannot be obtained due the the limitation of the batch implementation.

member.summary: Advances the data reader to the next result, when reading the results of batch SQL statements.

member.name: M:Spring.Data.Support.DataReaderWrapperBase.Read
member.summary: Advances the to the next record.
member.returns: true if there are more rows; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spring.Data.Support.DataReaderWrapperBase.Depth
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the depth of nesting for the current row.
member.returns: The level of nesting.

member.name: P:Spring.Data.Support.DataReaderWrapperBase.FieldCount
member.summary: Gets the number of columns in the current row.
member.returns: When not positioned in a valid recordset, 0; otherwise, the number of columns in the current record. The default is -1.

member.name: P:Spring.Data.Support.DataReaderWrapperBase.IsClosed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the data reader is closed.
member.returns: true if the data reader is closed; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Spring.Data.Support.DataReaderWrapperBase.RecordsAffected
member.summary: Gets the number of rows changed, inserted, or deleted by execution of the SQL statement.
member.returns: The number of rows changed, inserted, or deleted; 0 if no rows were affected or the statement failed; and -1 for SELECT statements.

member.name: M:Spring.Data.Support.OdpNetDataReaderWrapper.GetBoolean(System.Int32)
member.summary: Provide the implementation for . by assuming false.
member.param: The zero-based column ordinal.

returns.para: When the underlaying data column is a character string, a single character 'Y' indicates true and anything else indicates false.
When the underlaying data column is number type, zero value or indicates false, any other value indicates true.

member.exception: The index passed was outside the range of 0 through .
Field data type is neither character types nor number types.
